column4: when you run apt-get install ,where is the program installed ?
it depends on the package. Find out with 'dpkg -L packagename' where the various files go
and you're looking for a way to start it?
how come you had to install firefox -- it comes with Ubuntu by default...
it's on the default path. Open a terminal and enter 'firefox'
can you do a 'sudo apt-get -f install' and put any errors on http://paste.ubuntu.com
I asked  you to run 'sudo apt-get -f install'  (nothing else)
does 'sudo apt-get -f install' report  any errors?
what exactly do you get from 'firefox' in the terminal? (Use pastebin if there's a lot)
do you get a file listing from 'dpkg -L firefox'?
do you get any output from 'which firefox'?
from the menu bar, open Help-About
